h1: Calories in One Teaspoon of Sugar
assumptions: Granulated white sugar, level teaspoon (≈4 g), no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type, density (level vs. heaping), and brand; refined sugars are similar but check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of granulated sugar provides about 16 kcal, all from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one teaspoon of sugar?
faqs.a: Approximately 16 kcal for one level teaspoon of granulated white sugar.
Yes, 100% carbohydrates—about 4 g per teaspoon, all as sugars with no fiber, protein, or fat.

faqs.q: How does brown sugar compare to white?
faqs.a: Similar at ~17 kcal per teaspoon; brown has trace molasses for minimal extra calories and slight fiber.

faqs.q: What's the sugar content in one teaspoon?
faqs.a: Full 4 g of sugars, contributing to daily added sugar limits (aim under 25–50 g per day).
Yes—a heaping teaspoon can be 5–6 g (20–24 kcal); always level for accuracy.
